alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Mercer; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 11:07AM EST until March 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Virginia, northwest North Carolina and southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and weaker trees. The cold wind chills as low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wind and snow could lead to power outages, as well as reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Please report snow accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov or by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
